intro: Triathera juncea, commonly known as the slender rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, cylindrical stems that are often slightly hairy. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are arranged in a rosette at the base, and it produces small, inconspicuous greenish flowers in clusters. Triathera juncea thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in temperate regions. Its ability to tolerate waterlogged conditions makes it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
